title: Country star Gretchen Wilson calls for boycott after hotel kicked her out for 'no reason'
text:
CLOSE

Gretchen Wilson performs at the 7th annual Las Cruces Country Music Festival on Saturday, Oct. 12, 2019. (Photo: Jamie Guzman/For the Sun-News)

Country star Gretchen Wilson's hit song, "Here for the Party," features the lyrics, "And I ain't leaving till they throw me out."

The Grammy Award-winning artist lived up to those lyrics this weekend after Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces in New Mexico asked the artist to leave "in the middle of the night for no reason," she said.

Wilson called for a boycott of the property, claiming she was kicked out by police just hours after her headlining performance at the Las Cruces Country Music Festival.

"Was a guest in Las Cruces, NM, yesterday and had a blast with the people there. However, you should all band together to put Hotel Encanto out of business," Wilson tweeted to her fans. "Had to wait 2 hours for breakfast. Then they sent the police to kick me out in the middle of the night for no reason. I complied. Home early."

I got off stage at 11:30pm. At 12:30pm I was only talking in my room. The hotel informed me that QUIET HOURS started at 10pm. Wrong hotel for 3rd shifters. — Gretchen Wilson (@gw27) October 16, 2019

On Tuesday, she replied to her own tweet, stating: "I got off stage at 11:30pm. At 12:30pm I was only talking in my room. The hotel informed me that QUIET HOURS started at 10pm. Wrong hotel for 3rd shifters."

According to the 911 call, a hotel employee told dispatchers that Wilson had multiple noise complaints against her.

"We went up there multiple times the last half hour. So, I went up there and she said she was a celebrity but I forgot to get her name," the employee said. "Gretchen something, she participated in the country music festival and her words were, 'I paid for the room, I could care less what people think.' We had her escorted off property."

Dan Trujillo, spokesman for the Las Cruces Police Department, told the USA TODAY Network that the incident occurred a little after 3 a.m. on Sunday, Oct. 13.

"There were several noise complaints for a room," Trujillo said. "I'm not sure who was listed in the room but Ms. Wilson was in the room. We helped security remove the guest because they had worn out their welcome."

Trujillo said police were going to file charges but Wilson and her team voluntarily left on their own.

"(Police) were going to issue a trespass card but the occupants agreed to leave," he said. "(Police) stood by as they packed up."

Gretchen Wilson performs at the 7th annual Las Cruces Country Music Festival on Saturday. Early Sunday morning, employees at the hotel where Wilson was staying asked police to escort her from the property because they said she was making too much noise. (Photo: Jamie Guzman/For the Sun-News)

The hotel employee stated in the 911 call that even though Wilson was a celebrity, she still had to be treated like any other guest. The employee said Wilson was being "super loud" and no music or television was playing.

"Her level of talking is like our yelling," the employee said.

The USA TODAY Network made attempts to reach Wilson's management but did not receive a comment. Hotel Encanto and LCCMF organizers declined to comment on the incident.

This isn't the first time Wilson has had a run-in with the law. In August 2018, she was arrested at a Connecticut airport after what was described as a minor disturbance on an incoming flight. She was later charged with breach of peace.
